alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Monroe County through 215 PM CDT... At 141 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Red Boiling Springs, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Monroe County, including the following locations... Bugtussle, Gum Tree, Harlan Crossroads, Freetown, Gamaliel, Lamb, Flippin, Emberton, Mud Lick and Fountain Run. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
